categories.summary:
# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around challenges with Eliza OS V2, particularly regarding plugin development. Users express frustration with outdated documentation that doesn't match the latest code. The main technical discussion centers on how to add and test plugins in V2, with some community members providing solutions. A user named shaw mentions that V2 will be released in a couple of weeks with improved tutorials. The conversation also includes requests for plugin starters and references to the official documentation at docs.eliza.how. There are mentions of using commands like `elizaos --help` for the latest information and suggestions to use `npx @elizaos/cli@beta create` to create projects for plugin development.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How to add plugins in version V2 and test them after development? (asked by lantianlaoli) A: Put plugins into packages or use "npx @elizaos/cli@beta create" to create a project, then "bun run dev" in it, and add plugins by bun installing or adding to the character object in the plugins string (answered by shaw)
Q: Is there a plugin starter? (asked by ItzMrTobz) A: https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/tree/v2-develop/packages/plugin-starter (answered by sayonara)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: shaw | Helpee: lantianlaoli | Context: User confused about adding plugins in V2 | Resolution: Provided specific commands to create a project and add plugins using npx and bun
Helper: sayonara | Helpee: ItzMrTobz | Context: User looking for a plugin starter | Resolution: Shared GitHub link to the official plugin starter repository

## 4. Action Items
Type: Technical | Description: Update documentation to match latest code and commands | Mentioned By: lantianlaoli
Type: Documentation | Description: Create tutorial series for V2 | Mentioned By: shaw
Type: Feature | Description: Release V2 in a couple of weeks | Mentioned By: shaw

The chat segment is extremely brief, containing only a single message from user "shaw" saying "noted" at 22:19. There is no technical discussion, problem-solving, or decision-making present in this limited exchange. Without additional context, it appears to be an acknowledgment of previous information that is not included in the provided transcript.
Incorrect plugin path syntax in the test command (missing ./ prefix)
